com.hci.geotagger.activities
Class AddTagActivity

java.lang.Object
  Activity
      com.hci.geotagger.common.BaseActivity
          com.hci.geotagger.activities.AddTagActivity

public class AddTagActivity
extends com.hci.geotagger.common.BaseActivity

Addtag activity allows the user to add new tags to the database. This includes setting fields such as name/description and also setting an image for the tag and usinggeo-location. Chris Loeschorn Spring 2013

Nested Class Summary
(package private)  class AddTagActivity.AddTagTask
          This class extends AsyncTask and provides the methods to add a tag via an asynchronous task for background processing with callback.

uploadImage

private String uploadImage(File f)
Upload an image to the server and set the URL. Currently both the geotaggerdev and geotagger production server url returns a url that points to the geotagger production server, which is in turn stored persistently in the geotagger application. Therefore, a temporary fix for demo purposes is to replace "geotagger" string with "geotaggerdev" string to store the currently used development environment. Once this application points to the production environment, return original "response.url"

onCreate

protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
Intializes GPS location listener in case user uses gps coordinates for added tag, a new ImageHandler which will retrieve image from mediastore(using generic method regardless of device type), scale it to avoid using too much memory(which may cause crash on older phone) and upload it to server, and of initialize ui elements.

protected void onSaveInstanceState(Bundle outState)

onDestroy

protected void onDestroy()
Overidded activity onDestroy. Originally, this method Recycled imageView bitmap in an effort to save on native memory. However, this method caused crash. Also, starting with Android Honeycomb, bitmap memory is stored in VM, so there should be no concern regarding freeing memory. Next developer can decide if it is best to recycle bitmap for next iteration of geoTagger.
